# Contributing

Any and all contributions are encouraged.
Please follow the guidelines below for your contributions to be considered and for complete clarification on the process.

## Contributing Guidelines

1. **Adhere to the coding style** used in the project.
    - Use consistent indentation, naming conventions, and formatting.
    - Write clear and concise comments.
    - Write docstrings for all functions and classes.
2. **Follow the [contribution rules](#contribution-rules)**.
3. Respect the templates.
    - For issues, use the [issue template](./.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md).
    - For pull requests, fill out the [pull request template](./.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md).
4. **Follow the [code of conduct](./CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)**.

### Contribution Rules

- **Commit** your changes frequently while working with clear and understandable messages.
  - `(<type>) <short description>`
  - *`type` optional but recommended for clarity* (**see below**).

<blockquote>
    <details>
        <summary>
            <strong>
                Commit Types
            </strong>
        </summary>
        <table>
            <thead>
                <tr>
                    <th>Type</th>
                    <th>Example</th>
                    <th>Use Case</th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>fix</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(fix) typos in code</code></td>
                    <td>quality/readability fixes</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>tweak</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(tweak) improve performance</code></td>
                    <td>minor improvements or changes</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>docs</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(docs) module descriptions</code></td>
                    <td>documentation changes</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>feat</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(feat) add ARP discovery</code></td>
                    <td>new features</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>patch</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(patch) resolve #42</code></td>
                    <td>bug fixes (patches) with reference issue</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>refactor</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(refactor) optimize loop</code></td>
                    <td>code restructuring without changing behavior</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>deps</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(deps) bump to latest</code></td>
                    <td>dependency changes</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td><strong><code>test</code></strong></td>
                    <td><code>(test) add unit tests</code></td>
                    <td>adding or updating tests</td>
                </tr>
            </tbody>
        </table>
    </details>
</blockquote>

- Include/update docstrings, comments, and tests as necessary.
- All tests must pass before submission.
- Ensure all changes work locally and do not break existing functionality.
